utterance.content: Who piles clothes under the …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Getting a little nervous, Dex? Am I getting – – warmer?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Seriously?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Behind the –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was right there.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. Hi. I believe this is yours.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We know you were at the theater, Agnes. We found your prints.

utterance.speaker: AGNES MOLINA
utterance.content: Why do you think I ran? The second I heard Robyn was dead I knew you’d pin it on me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So you’re saying you didn’t kill Robyn? Because we heard you were pissed when she kicked you out of the group.

utterance.speaker: AGNES
utterance.content: Damn straight I was mad. But I walked it off just like my prison counselors taught me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: AGNES
utterance.content: Robyn called me yesterday. Asked me to meet her at the theater last night at 10.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: AGNES
utterance.content: She said she needed a bodyguard and somebody to keep her safe.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: A bodyguard? Agnes, come on. You can do better than that.

utterance.speaker: AGNES
utterance.content: It’s true! She offered me five hundred bucks. Money trumps feelings every time.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay, who did she need protection from?

utterance.speaker: AGNES
utterance.content: I don’t know. All she said was it was somebody from the a capella competition. She was going to tell me more when I got to the theater but I was a couple hours late and she wasn’t there so I left. But I guess she was there, huh? Dead.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We got witnesses that put Agnes in a diner across town during the time Robyn was killed.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Which means our killer was probably someone inside the competition.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys, who tipped Castle off?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not us. Not after, uh …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: After what?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Castle told us about …

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Svetlana.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He did? He – he told you about …

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Svetlana, yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’re so sorry, Beckett.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: If you want we can throw him down a flight of stairs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, no, I’ll – I’ll – I’ll take – yeah. I’ll handle this myself. Why don’t you guys go in and interview some people.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ow. Hey. Thanks for the call. I came as soon as I … … what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Svetlana?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I uh … I was going to tell you about that earlier but I thought it would be better if I told you in person, so …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So they boys, they got suspicious and accused me of cheating. I panicked and now they think I’m dating a Russian model named Svetlana.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you couldn’t think of a better name?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right? I know! It was the only name I could come up with. I don’t know why. But still, she’s a – she’s a model. She’s a really, really hot model.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Damn straight she is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me. Hi, I’m Captain Beckett. We need to speak with whoever’s in charge.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, so then you would have known Robyn King.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You don’t seem very shaken up by her death.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because they’re ex-cons, you mean.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Dr. Larson, where were you last night between 9 and 11.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Is this guy for real?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Unfortunately, yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So what do you want to do now, Captain?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s talk to the other contestants. Ryan, you’re with me. Espo, it’s you can Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: High five? High –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Excuse me, are you the Treble Boys?

utterance.speaker: HUNTER
utterance.content: The one and only badass crew. Who the hell are you?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: NYPD. We need to ask you a few questions.

utterance.speaker: HUNTER
utterance.content: Gotta say no, bro, we’re warming up for the show.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, that’s annoying. What do you want to do?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I got this. Hey. You want to sing? Let’s sing about Robyn King. But you best be straight, ‘cause baby you’ll hate, to feel the steel of my handcuffs.

utterance.speaker: HUNTER
utterance.content: Whoa.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Don’t you know, I’ll take you to the jail tonight.

utterance.speaker: GUY
utterance.content: This was Robyn’s dressing room.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: When was the last time you saw her?

utterance.speaker: GUY
utterance.content: Yesterday, right after rehearsal. Must have been about 5:30. She stormed out of here. Practically ran me over.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was she upset?

utterance.speaker: GUY
utterance.content: Very. But I don’t know why.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Where’d she go?

utterance.speaker: GUY
utterance.content: No idea. But I heard that she left the theater about a half hour later. The assistant stage manager saw her getting in a cab out front.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, well, I need to talk to him and we also need a copy of Robyn’s rehearsal schedule from yesterday.

utterance.speaker: GUY
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks. Here we go.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Beckett?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Are you doing okay?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I was crushed when I heard about … Svetlana.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You were?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh. Uh, well … you know, I think it’s for the best.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh yeah?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. As a matter of fact, I’m dating someone else, too. A Dr. … Livingstone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ryan? Do you hear that?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s a – oh, I got it. I spit all over myself.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You got me right in the eye.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I got you, too? Sorry. So maybe … kind of ruined the moment.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle? Is that you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’re just – what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re in the middle of Robyn’s dressing room. She ran out of here at 5:30 last night. Apparently she was very upset.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe over something she heard in here? Were any of you boys in this room at 5:30 last night?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’ve got a runner!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Move! Move, move, move, move!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t move.

utterance.speaker: HUNTER
utterance.content: This is all a big misunderstanding.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you seriously want to play that game?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, fine by us. Put your hands on your head.

utterance.speaker: HUNTER
utterance.content: Wait! Can we work something out?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. If you tell us the truth. Now, Robyn overheard something form your dressing room, didn’t she?

utterance.speaker: HUNTER
utterance.content: I knew that my group couldn’t beat the Aca-Cons, okay? Not with their feel good, Orange is the New Singing Sensation backstory. So I … I sort of …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you try to fix the competition?

utterance.speaker: HUNTER
utterance.content: Yeah. I bribed Dr. Larson.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The head judge?

utterance.speaker: HUNTER
utterance.content: He was the one who was going on and on about how the Aca-Cons shouldn’t even be in the competition. How they weren’t up to the standard of the AAC.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And did he accept your bribe?

utterance.speaker: HUNTER
utterance.content: Yeah, but Robyn overheard us and she burst in. She threatened to tell the national committee.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That sounds like motive for murder to me.

utterance.speaker: HUNTER
utterance.content: Not for me. Dr. Larson said he’d handle it and then he left with Robyn. That’s all I know.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh. So do we. People like Hunter. You know, he told us that you took a bribe to get the Aca-Cons out of the competition.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe he’s right.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, maybe. No, wait. It couldn’t be Hunter. Remember, he has an alibi.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, that’s right. Damn it, I guess we’re back to you, doc.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So what did you do? Arrange a meeting and when Robyn wouldn’t cooperate with you, is that when you killed her?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Peculiar?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So – so you’re saying that changed her mind about ratting you out because of what she saw on some video?

utterance.speaker: ROBYN
utterance.content: Ironically I didn’t find my love for singing until I went to prison.

utterance.speaker: NARRATOR
utterance.content: At 18, Robyn had already been running drugs for two years. Her life was a mess and after making a delivery to a country club party she stole and crashed a car.

utterance.speaker: ROBYN
utterance.content: Truth is, I was so wasted I don’t even remember what happened.

utterance.speaker: NARRATOR
utterance.content: Robyn was trapped in the burning car. But then, the universe sent her a hero.

utterance.speaker: PERCY JOHNSON III
utterance.content: I was driving home, and then oh my God. A car crash. I pulled Robyn out, I dragged her to safety, and then I had to tourniquet her leg with her scarf to stop all of the bleeding.

utterance.speaker: NARRATOR
utterance.content: And like a phoenix rising from the ashes Robyn emerged from this tragedy and started a new life.

utterance.speaker: ROBYN
utterance.content: That crash was the best thing that ever happened to me. Because in prison I got clean, hooked up with the NBP, and … it saved my life.

utterance.speaker: NARRATOR
utterance.content: Ladies and gentlemen … the Aca-Cons.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why would Robyn be so interested in this?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. I managed to track down that cab that Robyn jumped into after she got the DVD from Dr. Larson.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Where’d she go?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Townhouse on the Upper East Side.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And look who lives there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That cannot be a coincidence.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, you saw Robyn the night that he was murdered, huh?

utterance.speaker: PERCY
utterance.content: Yeah. It’s kind of eerie if you think about it, huh?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. I mean, why would she visit?

utterance.speaker: PERCY
utterance.content: Well, she wanted to thank me personally. You see, Robyn was unconscious when I saved her. And then after she recovered she went straight to prison, so we never actually properly met.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, well, Percy, you are a real hero.

utterance.speaker: PERCY
utterance.content: No, you’re the heroes. I was just in the right place at the right time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh uh. No, don’t be so modest. If you didn’t make a tourniquet out of that scarf Robyn could have bled out and died. Speaking of that scarf, where did it come from?

utterance.speaker: PERCY
utterance.content: Um … Robyn was wearing it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She was?

utterance.speaker: PERCY
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh. That’s funny. Because we reached out to the hospital where Robyn was taken. And on her intake form there’s a bit of a fashion discrepancy. You see, Robyn’s entire outfit was worth about fifty dollars. But the scarf that you used, it was an Hermes scarf and that was worth about two grand. So what I’m wondering is, why are you lying to me?

utterance.speaker: PERCY
utterance.content: Okay. Can you keep a secret?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. But you’re going to tell me anyway.

utterance.speaker: PERCY
utterance.content: I didn’t save Robyn’s life. By the time I got there she was already safe and passed out cold and the scarf tourniquet was on her leg.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why would you like about that?

utterance.speaker: PERCY
utterance.content: Duh. To be a hero. Do you know how many Twitter followers I got after that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So Robyn figured out what really happened and that’s why she came to your house?

utterance.speaker: PERCY
utterance.content: She wanted the truth, so I told her. Somebody else pulled her from the car, then they must have run off.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s what all of this must have been about. Robyn was digging into her old arrest.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, and whatever she found got her killed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: In that video Robyn said she was so high she didn’t remember anything. So how does she know that she’s the one who stole that car?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Because Percy said she was alone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But he was lying. Someone else was there. And what if that someone was the one driving the car? Think about it. A reason to leave the scene of an accident is that you were the one responsible.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So someone else crashed the car, pulled Robyn out, ran off, leaving Robyn to take the fall.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But not before bandaging Robyn’s leg with their own scarf.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So if Robyn found out who that scarf belonged to and then confronted them –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s a good chance that person’s our killer.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, guys. I talked to the country club and I think I found the woman who threw that party. Her name is Chloe Jarvis and apparently she is like, the Paris Hilton of Long Island.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You say that like it’s a good thing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, but that party was years ago. How are we going to find out who was wearing that scarf?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Photos. Because Chloe has a Snappamatic account.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Smart thinking! Hopefully the photos of that party are still up.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Damn. Chloe’s account it private. And we don’t have enough probable cause yet to justify a warrant.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Excuse me. The NYPD may need probably cause. Richard Castle Investigations, however –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, Castle. You cannot hack Chloe’s account on behalf of the NYPD.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We absolutely forbid you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Honestly, how did you guys ever solve murders without me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All the time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, where’s Castle going?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You don’t want to know. ‘cause Beckett, you don’t need him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And – and look, just so you know, you get us in the breakup, okay?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Damn straight.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anyway … um, I was looking over Robyn’s arrest reports from the Suffolk County PD. It’s pretty thin, but apparently the evidence box in their property room is missing. Which means either they’re practicing really shoddy police work –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Or somebody helped our mystery driver to frame Robyn.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Exactly. The arresting officer’s name is Dan O’Grady. He just retired from job and moved to Manhattan.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Kind of cushy for a cop on a pension, huh?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. Bring him in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, evidence is missing. Specifically the Hermes scarf that was sent over by the hospital. So what did you do with it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m not accusing you. Your own bank account is. A week after Robyn took a plea deal you made five deposits, $9,900 each over five days.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The moment you leave this office I will be calling Internal Affairs. What do you want me to tell them? That you were helpful in solving Robyn’s homicide or that you obstructed justice? It’s your call.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: From who?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I am in Chloe’s account.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now, Alexis, do a search for Chloe’s golf course party at the country club.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, there’s Robyn! Oh … she was such a lovely young woman.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And she’s not wearing the scarf.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I don’t see anyone that is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait. There.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: There’s the scarf.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So the woman who saved Robyn’s life is also the one who took it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Linda, how did you know Robyn?

utterance.speaker: LINDA
utterance.content: Through NBP. She was one of our first prison participants.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, actually you met long before that. Except Robyn was too wasted to remember.

utterance.speaker: LINDA
utterance.content: I guess we both didn’t remember.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s a wonderful scarf. Very expensive. It’s very generous of you to use it to save Robyn’s life, but then again it’s the least you could do considering you’re the one who crashed the car.

utterance.speaker: LINDA
utterance.content: No I didn’t. You know what? It’s coming back to me now. I gave Robyn that scarf at the party. As a gift.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, Linda, I get it. You were scared. If found out you would be sent to prison. Kicked out of law school. Your entire future would go up in flames, so you ran and let Robyn take the fall.

utterance.speaker: LINDA
utterance.content: You can’t prove any of this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I wouldn’t be too sure about that. I traced the call made to Officer O’Grady. It was from your phone. I also spoke to your bank. They found the fifty thousand dollar withdrawal used to pay him off.

utterance.speaker: LINDA
utterance.content: I don’t know what I was thinking. I panicked. And after Robyn went to jail I just – I felt so guilty.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is that why you started NBP?

utterance.speaker: LINDA
utterance.content: I thought maybe I could help Robyn somehow. Make a difference.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Except she found out the truth, confronted her, and that’s why you killed her?

utterance.speaker: LINDA
utterance.content: I didn’t kill Robyn. I – I didn’t even know she found out the truth.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, Linda, it’s time to come clean.

utterance.speaker: LINDA
utterance.content: I just did. I crashed the car, fled the scene. But I didn’t kill Robyn. I was in Philadelphia on business at the time of the murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who else knew about the crash?

utterance.speaker: LINDA
utterance.content: I’d like to speak to my lawyer now.

utterance.speaker: STAGE MANAGER
utterance.content: All groups, final checks. Ten minutes until curtain.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, Richard, thank you for letting me be here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course, Mother. You should be here.

utterance.speaker: SCOTT
utterance.content: Linda, hey, it’s me. The show’s about to start. Where are you?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mr. Weinberg, you can hang up the phone. You’re wife’s being held at the Twelfth Precinct.

utterance.speaker: SCOTT
utterance.content: Why? What the hell is going on here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We know you killed Robyn.

utterance.speaker: SCOTT
utterance.content: Excuse me, but that’s absurd.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We canvassed around your apartment. We found one of your shirts in a dumpster with Robyn’s blood on it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When she realized your wife was behind the car accident Robyn came looking for her, didn’t she?

utterance.speaker: SCOTT
utterance.content: She was pissed. And Linda was out of town, so I told Robyn I’d have Linda meet her at her job.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But you just wanted to get her alone so you could kill her and bury your wife’s secret forever.

utterance.speaker: SCOTT
utterance.content: No. I wanted to make her understand that if the truth came out it would ruin everything. All we had worked for. All that you girls had worked for.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: And that’s why you killed her?

utterance.speaker: SCOTT
utterance.content: No. No, no. It was an accident. She was calling me a liar and a hypocrite and I just – I pushed her and suddenly she hit her head on –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Scott Weinberg, you’re under arrest for the murder of Robyn King.

utterance.speaker: STAGE MANAGER
utterance.content: Final rehearsal. Aca-Cons, you’re up next.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh. Oh, are you Robyn’s girls? Oh, listen. I’m an acquaintance of hers. My name is Martha Rodgers. I only have one real specialty performance, but if I can assist you in any way at all –

utterance.speaker: CHARISSE
utterance.content: Absolutely.

utterance.speaker: AGNES
utterance.content: That would be great, yes.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Yes? Okay. Darling, could you hold that for me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You going to work your magic, Mother?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: You bet your best-selling novels I am, kiddo. Now you listen to me. I know how hard this is, all right? But you can do this. You can rise above your sorrow and win this for Robyn. Yes?

utterance.speaker: AGNES
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Let’s go. I want you to go up there, take a deep breath, put her right in the …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guys, I really appreciate you letting me help out on this one.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, you know. We’d do anything for Martha.
